oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Farmers at Temperance hall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photograph of Temperance Hall in DeKalb County, where farmers have congregated to hear Bethel Thomas, their County Agent, explain the Home Food Supply Program. Most of the men are wearing overalls and all of the men are wearing hats.

"It was interesting to learn that a majority of the people in this community are already producing 75% or more of their living on the farm." The Home Food Supply Program was a war-relief program instituted by the administration of Gov. Prentice Cooper, Tennessee.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hats; Overalls; Meetings; Men
Agriculture; People; Farmers; War relief; Halls
